## Discussion

Check the status of Rosetta by examining the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZLinuxRosettaDirectoryShare/availability] class property before creating a new Rosetta directory share to ensure the capability is both supported and available on host Mac. # init()

**Initializer**

Creates a new Rosetta directory share, or returns an error if Rosetta isn’t installed.

## Declaration

```swift
init() throws
```

## Discussion

Check the status of Rosetta by examining the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZLinuxRosettaDirectoryShare/availability] class property before creating a new Rosetta directory share to ensure the capability is both supported and available on host Mac. For complete instructions on installing Rosetta see [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/running-intel-binaries-in-linux-vms-with-rosetta].
title: init()
